body: I don't understand this. Screenshot?

After selecting "Restart" in the menu following screen appears:

![bildschirmfoto vom 2014-08-24 10 18 25](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5201818/4022936/775ce866-2b67-11e4-9434-f5514ce82564.png)

And it stays. You have to do a refresh in the browser with keys "Cntr R". In older versions, this happened automatically.
Which version are you running?

0.9.8

On 24. August 2014 12:09:16 MESZ, Audrius Butkevicius notifications@github.com wrote:

> Which version are you running?
> 
> ---
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/560#issuecomment-53186679
I'm getting the same, v0.9.8 on linux x64 and Firefox 31.

Can you open Chrome/Firefox debugging tools, and see if as you restart you get a network error as such:
![](http://i.snag.gy/wYrW6.jpg)

Followed by UIOffline event

I get this:

```
"Error: data.forEach is not a function
successFn@http://127.0.0.1:8080/app.js:39:13
s/h.success/<@http://127.0.0.1:8080/angular.min.js:66:351
zd/e/k.promise.then/C@http://127.0.0.1:8080/angular.min.js:92:404
zd/e/k.promise.then/C@http://127.0.0.1:8080/angular.min.js:92:404
zd/g/<.then/<@http://127.0.0.1:8080/angular.min.js:94:54
Ad/this.$get</h.prototype.$eval@http://127.0.0.1:8080/angular.min.js:102:282
Ad/this.$get</h.prototype.$digest@http://127.0.0.1:8080/angular.min.js:100:42
Ad/this.$get</h.prototype.$apply@http://127.0.0.1:8080/angular.min.js:103:98
f@http://127.0.0.1:8080/angular.min.js:67:85
E@http://127.0.0.1:8080/angular.min.js:71:117
od/</v.onreadystatechange@http://127.0.0.1:8080/angular.min.js:72:159
"
```

Can you add `console.debug(data)` just above the foreach call, and see what that prints out?
You will have to recompile the assets `./build.sh assets` and rebuild syncthing for that to show up in the JS.

Alternatively you can just modify the JS in the developer tools.
I just set a breakpoint, looks like data is an empty string (`data: ""`).

Can you modify the callback signatures so be

``` javascript
var successFn = function (data, status, headers, config) {
...
var errorFn = function (data, status, headers, config) {
```

And see what's the value of status and headers?

Sorry, I am on Windows so I cannot test this myself until Tuesday.

Have you tried to reproduce in Firefox? Because this does not happen in Chromium for me.

Otherwise I'll change and build it.
Works perfectly on Windows.

After checking out HEAD, this does not occur.

For completeness, here's some of the info on v0.9.8:
status: 200
headers: mc/<(c)

(not sure what's important there)

This makes no sense, as HEAD and 0.9.8 are 3 commits apart, none of which have anything to do with that part of the code.

I think it might start working if you add breakpoints.
Also the value of headers makes no sense, how are you retrieving the value?
Are you sure you are capturing the right call?
If you just add logging lines and no breakpoints it might behave differently and give different results.

Also, can you do a `curl -v http://127.0.0.1:8080/rest/events?since=9999` and see what it returns when you restart?

And as a last step, at the start of the callback, try adding:

``` javascript
if (!data) return errorFn(data);
```

check and see if that helps.

Well I can reproduce it working breaking with HEAD vs v0.9.8.

The curl doesn't return anything, is `curl -v http://127.0.0.1:8080/rest/events?since=9999 --header "X-API-Key: xyz" right for they api key? (I also tried without it).

The errorFn call doesn't seem to fix it (in v0.9.8, just writes "UIOffline" to console).

Sorry, I don't understand your first sentence, can you reproduce working or can you reproduce breaking?

`curl` should print the headers as they arrive atleast.

Is the `UIOnline` getting fired after the `UIOffline`?
I guess the best way to track this is to look at the network log seeing how requests are getting fired and what is the response being received.
Ok, I seem to have reproduced this on Windows, but it happens quite rarely.

issue.title: Fix race condition while restarting (fixes #560)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
It seems to happen much more often now (as described in #533)
Probably fixes #560

body: The issue is still or again there in 0.9.9 on Firefox 31/linux-amd64.

I think this will haunt me till the day I die.

Can you provide the JS console output, HAR export or perhaps a wireshark pcap dump?
Saga continues on #577

issue.title: Web GUI doesn't restart on restart (minor bug)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
On Firefox 31, mac os 10.9.4, when I restart, the GUI hangs on "restarting..."  Refreshing the page currently solves the issue.

new to & loving syncthing!
